subject: Music
title: Duke Ellington's Orchestra
description: A quick win: understand Duke Ellington's Orchestra.

hook.text: Duke Ellington led a band for 50 years and never repeated himself.

buildup.text: His orchestra at the Cotton Club in Harlem became the most celebrated in jazz history.

discovery.text: He composed over 1,000 pieces â€” writing parts tailored to each musician's unique sound.

twist.text: He called his music American Music, not jazz â€” he refused to be limited by labels.

climax.text: From three-minute songs to hour-long suites, he expanded what jazz could contain.

punchline.text: Ellington didn't play an instrument. His instrument was the orchestra.

quiz.question: How many compositions did Duke Ellington write?
